title: Render Monitor
description: An iOS and iPadOS utility app that helps 3D artists plan, estimate, and monitor Blender renders remotely.
details: Render Monitor enables artists and studios to estimate render time and storage requirements before starting a project, and optionally monitor ongoing Blender renders in real time using a companion Blender add-on. The app includes time and space calculators, live render progress tracking, estimated completion projections, crash detection alerts, and frame previews for Pro users. Built to improve planning, productivity, and reliability for long-running renders, with optional Pro features unlocked via a monthly subscription.

title: ChAir : Privacy Focused Offline iOS Chat App
description: An iOS app enabling anonymous, offline peer-to-peer chat and share using Multipeer Connectivity.
details: ChAir (Chat Over Air) is built with SwiftUI and Apple’s MultipeerConnectivity framework to allow users to anonymously communicate with nearby peers over local Wi-Fi or Bluetooth without internet access or personal data sharing. It features dynamic chat rooms, private peer sessions, auto-deleting messages, image and document sharing, randomized peer names for anonymity, and a modern UI styled for iOS 26. The project is open source.

title: Marathi Speech Audio Classification
description: A deep learning–based system to classify real human and AI-synthesized Marathi speech.
details: Focuses on detecting synthesized audio in regional languages by analyzing Marathi speech using Mel-spectrogram–based feature extraction. Utilizes a CNN trained on 28,863 audio samples with a 70/15/15 train-test-validation split to capture formants, harmonics, and perceptual frequency patterns. Achieves an accuracy of 99.68%, demonstrating strong capability in distinguishing human and AI-generated speech and helping mitigate risks of digital audio deception.

title: Multimodal Deepfake Detection System
description: A research study focused on detecting deepfakes using combined visual, audio, and emotional cues to combat misinformation and identity fraud.
details: Proposes a multimodal deepfake detection approach by analyzing facial emotion reactions and voice features. Integrates FER for emotion classification and a BERT-based sentiment analysis model to compare emotional consistency between audio and visual data. Achieves an accuracy of 85.50%, identifying videos as suspicious deepfakes when sentiment agreement drops below 40%. Emphasizes the importance of advanced detection systems to preserve digital trust and integrity amid rapid growth of synthetic media.

title: VRET for Hydrophobia
description: A study on using Virtual Reality Exposure Therapy (VRET) to treat hydrophobia, the fear of water.
details: Explores the mechanisms, benefits, limitations, and outcomes of VR-based exposure therapy for hydrophobia. Highlights advantages such as safe virtual environments, patient confidentiality, and elimination of real-world exposure, while emphasizing the need for further research and technological advancements, Developed using Blender and Unity, and tested using META 2 oculus glases. Published as a book chapter research.
